quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43994.1.   The Enterprise has arrived at   Jouret Four in response to a   distress signal from one of the   Federation's outermost colonies.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Anything from the surface?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Nossir. There have been no   communications from the colony   for over twelve hours.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sensors picking up any signs of   life?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: None.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The surface environment is safe   for transport, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister O'Brien, verify these are   accurate coordinates for New   Providence colony.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Coordinates verified, sir. You're   at the center of town.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43997.6.   Admiral Hanson and Lieutenant   Commander Shelby of Starfleet   Tactical have arrived to review   the disappearance of New   Providence colony. No sign   remains of the nine hundred   inhabitants.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The truth is... hell, we're not   ready. We've known they were   coming for over a year... we've   thrown every resource we've got   into this but still...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Then, you're convinced it is the   Borg... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: That's what I'm here to find out.   The initial descriptions of these   surface conditions are almost   identical to your reports from   system J-two-five.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister Riker wrote those   reports... he agrees with you.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Shelby took over Borg   tactical analysis six months ago.   I've learned to give her a wide   latitude when I want to get things   done... That's how I intend to   operate here.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: My priority has been to develop   some kind, any kind of defense   strategy...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Obviously nothing we have now can   stop them.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've been designing new   weapons... but they're still on   the drawing board.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We expected much more lead time.   Your encounter with the Borg was   over seven thousand light years   away...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If this is the Borg, it would   indicate they have a source of   power far superior to our own...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'd like to see the colony site   as soon as possible, Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It'll be night at the site in   thirty minutes. We've scheduled   an away team for dawn.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Why don't you show the commander   to her quarters...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It's our poker night, Admiral.   There's always an open seat for   you...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Next time, Commander. Your   captain and I have a lot to cover.   But rumor has it that Commander   Shelby's played a hand or two...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Keep your eye on her, Jean-Luc.   One impressive young lady...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You seem rather taken with her,   J.P.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Just an old man's fantasies. When   Shelby came into tactical, every   damned admiral's uncle had a take   on this Borg business... she cut   through it, put us on track.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Earl Grey?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Four sugars.       She'd make you a hell of a first   officer.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I already have a hell of a first   officer.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Don't tell me he's gonna pass up   another commission?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: One's available?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The Melbourne. It's his if he   wants it. Hasn't he told you?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Well, I guess I knew this day   would have to come... he'll make   a fine captain, J.P.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You may want to tell him that.       We're still waiting for his   decision. Hell, this is the third   time we've pulled out the   captain's chair for Riker. He   just won't sit down. And I'll   tell you something -- there are   a lot of young hotshots like   Shelby on their way up. Riker   could suddenly look like he's   standing still next to them. He's   hurting his career by staying put.   If I were you, I'd kick him in   the rear end for his own good.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We know the Borg have no interest   in power or political conquest...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They identify what's useful to   them, then consume it. Or try   to at least...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: But here's the question -- after   they take what they want... what   happens to the rest?       There has to be some evidence...   residue... something that tells   us they've been here.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I don't know exactly what I'm   looking for... but we've tested   the sections of the Enterprise's   hull that were damaged by the   Borg. There were some unusual   magnetic-resonance traces...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: A Borg footprint?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: That's my theory. I'll see if   it holds up tomorrow.       I've reviewed your personnel...   I'll be assigning Mister La Forge   and Mister Data to accompany me   on the away team...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I've... already assigned them to   the away team, Commander. And   I'll be with you as well.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Of course. I appreciate any   assistance you can offer.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Tell me, something, Commander...   is serving aboard the Enterprise   as extraordinary an experience   as I've heard?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Every bit of it.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Good.    (intimately sharing a     secret)   Because I intend to convince   Captain Picard that I'm the right   choice for the job.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Job? Which job... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Yours, of course.    (off his look,     "embarrassed")   I'm sorry... I heard you were   leaving.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If I am... I'm sure you'll be the   first to know, Commander.       Poker's at seventeen hundred   hours, my quarters, deck eight...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I will buy another card,   Counselor.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Got another king in the hole,   Data?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I am afraid I cannot answer that   Wesley. And as you are a newcomer   to the game, may I say it is   inappropriate to ask.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: No help there.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fold. Again.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm in.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Three jacks looking back for the   handsome young ensign.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Beginner's luck.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Pair of deuces stands.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Possible flush, possible straight   flush. The bet is yours, Mister   Crusher.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm in for ten...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Time to put on the long pants,   Wes. I'll see your ten. And   raise you a hundred.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: He's got the straight flush.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Not necessarily. Commander Riker   may be bluffing, Wesley.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I don't think so. I fold.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: With three jacks?       Wesley, you may get straight A's   in school, but you've still got   a little to learn about poker...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I've only got two pair, Commander.   But I've got to see that blind   card. I'll call.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You got him!
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister Data and our guest appear   to be tardy...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, Commander Shelby and Data   beamed down to the planet surface   an hour ago...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On whose authority?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On... hers, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Morning. Early bird gets the   worm, eh? We've had some   interesting results...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Shelby...    (he pauses, will not     do this in front of     the other officers)   Walk with me, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I believe Commander Shelby   erred... there are no known   avifaunal or crawling vermicular   lifeforms on Jouret Four.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: That's... not what she meant,   Data... but, uh, you're right,   she erred...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm sorry... I woke up early and   I saw a weather system was moving   in... it could have affected the   soil readings...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: So without any regard to the risk   of coming down alone...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Really, Commander... if we ran   into the Borg, two extra bodies   wouldn't've made a hell of a   difference, would they? We had   three hours before the storm front   hit, less than two hours now.   Data was available. I took him.   We came. I don't see your   problem...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: My problem, Commander, is I expect   to be notified before there's a   change in my orders...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Noted for future reference. Do   you wish to hear my report, sir?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Go ahead.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The soil contains the same   magnetic-resonance traces...   That's our footprint. There's   no doubt any more. It's the Borg.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43998.5.   With confirmation of the Borg's   presence in Federation space,   Admiral Hanson has returned to   Starbase three two four to discuss   strategy with Starfleet Command.   Lieutenant Commander Shelby   remains on board to continue   tactical preparations.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: ... a standing Yellow Alert...   all Federation and allied outposts   have been warned... Ops will   continue to monitor long range   sensors... I've assigned Data,   La Forge and Mister Crusher to   work with Commander Shelby.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Very good, Number One. You've   covered all the bases. As usual.       What's your impression of Shelby?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She knows her stuff, Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She has your full confidence...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Well, I think she needs...   supervision.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She takes the initiative a little   too... easily. Sometimes with   risks.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sounds a little like a young   lieutenant commander I once   recruited as my first officer.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Perhaps.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You're the best officer I've ever   served with, Will.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: But what are you still doing here?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I hear you've been offered the   Melbourne.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I've decided not to pursue the   commission at this time.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She's a fine ship, Will.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She's not the Enterprise.       With all due respect, sir, you   need me. Particularly now.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Starfleet needs good captains.   Particularly now. I cannot keep   you to myself forever.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I want you to reconsider your   decision.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Are you asking me to leave,   Captain?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm asking you to look at your   career objectively and make the   best decision.       I know it's hard to walk away.   But you're ready to work without   a net, my friend. You're ready   to make the life and death   decisions a captain must make.   And, hard as it is to accept, if   you choose to leave, the   Enterprise will go on just fine   without you.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What am I still doing here,   Deanna? I've pushed myself hard   to get this far...       ... sacrificed a lot.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I've always said I wanted my own   command. And yet something's   holding me back. Is it wrong to   want to stay... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What do you think?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: (shakes his head,     doesn't know)   Maybe I'm just afraid of the big   chair.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I don't think so.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The captain says Shelby reminds   him of the way I used to be. And   he's right. She comes in here,   full of drive and ambition,   impatient, taking risks... I look   at her and I wonder whatever   happened to those things in me? I   I liked those things in me.       I've lost something.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You mean you're older, more   experienced... a little more   seasoned...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: "Seasoned". What a horrible thing   to say to a man.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I don't think you've lost a   thing... and you've gained a lot   more than you realize. You're   much more comfortable with   yourself than you used to be...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Maybe that's the problem. Could   be I'm too comfortable here.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm not sure I know what that   means.       You're happy here... happier than   I've ever known you to be. It   really comes down to a simple   question -- what do you want, Will   Riker?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Stupid. An old song I heard when   I was a kid. Keeps running   through my mind...    (off her look, he begins     to sing)   "Didja ever have the feeling that   you wanted to go... still had the   feeling that you wanted to stay...   You knew it was right... wasn't   wrong... still you knew you   wouldn't be very long... it's   tough to have the feeling that   you wanted to go... "
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: "... still had the feeling that   you wanted to stay... start to   go... change your mind... "
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You start on Friday -- two shows   a night, matinee on Wednesday.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I play the trombone too...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: ... a manipulation effect in the   Borg ship's subspace field...   a definite pattern -- at   four-point-eight minute intervals   during your first confrontation   with them.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Might indicate high-output   auxiliary generators kicking in.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: One theory is that their systems   are decentralized with redundant   power sources located throughout   the ship.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It is a reasonable conclusion.   Borg technology has given each   member of their society the   ability to interface and function   collectively. It is likely they   would construct their ship with   the same philosophy.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Knock out one generator and   another takes over without   interruption.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What kind of damage would we have   to do to shut them down... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Projections suggest a Borg ship   like this one could continue to   function effectively even if   seventy-eight percent of it was   inoperable.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: And our best shot barely scratched   the surface.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: From what I've seen, I can't   believe any of your new weapons   systems can be ready in less than   eighteen months, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've been projecting twenty-four.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Is there anything here we can try   to adapt to our current defense   systems... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll have to look through the   specs again.       I don't know. My mind's turned   to clay.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mine too.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I think we should look at   modifying the plasma phaser   design...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander, I think we should call   it a night.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: All right. Anyone who's really   that tired... if you want to   leave...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: No, that's okay...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Go ahead, Commander...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What would happen if we take the   frequency klystron from the   existing unit...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll break here. That's an   order. We'll reconvene at oh five   hundred...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, if you'll allow me to   continue with Mister Data, who   does not require rest...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You need rest, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If we have a confrontation with   the Borg without improving our   defense systems...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If we have a confrontation, I   don't want a crew fighting the   Borg at the same time they're   fighting their own fatigue...   Dismissed.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: At nineteen hundred hours   yesterday, the USS Lalo   departed Zeta Alpha Two on a   freight run to Sentinel Minor   Four. At twenty-two hundred hours   and twelve minutes, a distress   signal was received at Starbase   one five seven. The Lalo reported   contact with an alien vessel...       ... described as cube-shaped. The   distress signal ended abruptly.   She has not been heard from since.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: How long to get there at warp   nine, Mister Data?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: One hour, seventeen minutes, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Make it so.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We're coming with every available   starship to assist, Captain. But   the closest help is six days away.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll try to occupy them pending   your arrival, Admiral.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I know you will. Hanson out.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: All hands will stand to battle   stations...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Shelby, status of   defense preparations?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister La Forge has a plan to   modulate shield nutation...   hopefully, that'll hold them off   for awhile.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: At the same time, we're retuning   phasers to higher EM-base   emitting frequencies -- we'll try   to disrupt their subspace field.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Your assessment of our potential   effectiveness?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shot in the dark, Captain. Best   we can do for now.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Dismissed.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, reading an unidentified   vessel just entering sensor range,   bearing two-one-zero mark   one-five-one...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Hail them, Mister Worf...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: No response, sir...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Move to intercept.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: (beat, reacting to     console)   Sir, the vessel has already   changed course to intercept us.   Approaching at... warp nine point   three... Entering visual   range...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On screen.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Magnify.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister Worf, dispatch a subspace   message to Admiral Hanson -- we   have engaged the Borg.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain, you are being hailed.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I am?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Yes, Captain. By name.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Data, is it the same ship we faced   at J-two-five?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Uncertain, Commander. However,   dimensions are precisely the same.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On screen.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I am Jean-Luc...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Jean-Luc Picard, captain of the   Starship Enterprise, registry   NCC-1701D, you will lower shields   and prepare to transport yourself   aboard our vessel. If you do not   cooperate, we will destroy your   ship.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You have committed acts of   aggression against the United   Federation of Planets. If you   do not immediately withdraw...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You will surrender yourself or   we will destroy your ship. Your   defensive capabilities are unable   to withstand us.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What the hell could they want with   you?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I thought they weren't interested   in human lifeforms... only our   technology.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Their priorities seem to have   changed. Open channel.       We have developed new defense   capabilities since our last   meeting and we are prepared to   use them if you do not withdraw   from Federation space. If you   do so immediately, I will agree   to arrange a conference of our   peoples at a neutral location.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shields are being probed... I'm   modulating nutation...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, the Borg are attempting to   lock on to us with their tractor   beam...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Load all torpedo bays... ready   phasers... target coordinates on   the source of the tractor beam...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Status of shields...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Holding...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The nutation modulation has them   confused...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They have the ability to analyze   and adapt, Commander...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shield modulation has failed...   they've locked on...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shields are being drained...   ninety per cent... eighty...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Trying to recalibrate nutation...   damn...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shields have failed.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fire all weapons...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Their subspace field is intact...   new phaser frequencies had no   impact...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Reverse engines...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Full reverse... we're not   moving...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fire at will...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Launching torpedos... phaser   spread continuing...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Still no damage to the Borg   vessel, sir...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Warning. Outer hull breach.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They're cutting into the hull...   Engineering section...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Geordi... evacuate Engineering...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Computer. Evacuation sequence...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Redirecting Engineering control   to bridge. Sealing doors to core   chamber...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Move it people!
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Warning. Inner hull failing.   Decompression danger, deck   thirty-six, section four.   Sealing Main Engineering.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Data, fluctuate phaser resonance   frequencies... random settings...   keep changing them... don't give   them time to adapt...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The tractor beam has been   released.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Warp nine. Course one-five-one   mark three-three-zero... engage...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They are in pursuit, Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Maintain course.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Damage report, Geordi.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Hull rupture in Main   Engineering... damage is heavy...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We lost a lot of good people down   there.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Eleven dead... eight more   unaccounted for, Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Repair teams to Engineering...   seal hull breach...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They didn't get to the core...   I can control functions from   here...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Approaching the Paulson Nebula,   sir...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Drop to impulse... take us in,   Ensign...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The field is getting too dense,   sir...
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDE MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Steady... Mister Data, analysis   of the nebula cloud...
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDE MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Eighty-two percent Dilithium   hydroxyls... manganese, chromium.   It should provide an effective   screen against their sensors,   sir...
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDE MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Prepare to take us in, Mister   Crusher. Now. Mister La Forge,   prepare to reverse engines, full   stop.
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDE MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The Borg ship is continuing   scans... attempting to locate   us...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Good. As long as they're looking   for us... they can't hurt anyone   else.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shut down all active sensors,   passive scanners only. Deflectors   to minimum emissions.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll maintain position.    (looks at Riker and     Shelby)   Until we have a better idea.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Time index five-one-four... Data   started to fluctuate phaser   resonance frequencies... the   Borg's beam breaks contact...   Freeze picture.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Take a close look, Commander...   Mister La Forge?
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: There's a two percent power drop,   just for an instant... but it's   system-wide... The phaser   frequency spread was in a high   narrow band.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Conceivably, the ship's power   distribution nodes are vulnerable   to those frequencies.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If we can generate a concentrated   burst of energy with that same   frequency distribution... I mean   a lot more than anything our   phasers or photon torpedos could   provide...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: How do we do that?
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The main deflector dish.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It's the only component of the   Enterprise designed to channel   that much power at controlled   frequencies.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Unfortunately, there is one slight   detail -- in the process, the   blast completely destroys the   Enterprise as well.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: But if we could get far enough   away... increase the deflector   range...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It could work. In the meantime,   we should retune all phasers,   including hand units, to the same   frequency.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Proceed. I'll inform the   Captain...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: There's one other recommendation   I'd like to make, Commander.   Separate the saucer section...   assign a skeleton crew to create   a diversion...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We may need power from the saucer   impulse engines...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: But it would give them more than   one target to worry about.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: No, it's too great a risk...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'd like the captain to make that   decision, sir.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I bring all alternatives to the   captain's attention, Commander.       That'll be all.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'll need to install   higher-capacity power transfers   to the deflector dish,   Commander...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: How long...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Better part of a day.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: She gets a full head of steam up,   doesn't she...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Yessir... she's... a formidable   presence to say the least. But   I'm convinced she can help us   here, Commander...
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I am too, Geordi. Don't worry   about it. I can handle Shelby.
scene: 48   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Come.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Come in, Number One... Commander   Shelby was just telling me of your   concerns about her plan...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm sorry that she troubled you,   sir... I already informed her...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Yes, I entirely agree with you.   It's not the time. But I am   afraid the time may eventually   come when greater risks are   required. I'd like you to   consider her plan as a fall-back   position and make the necessary   preparations.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Very good, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Deck eight. Battle bridge.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Halt.       You and I have to talk, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You never ordered me not to   discuss this with the captain...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You disagree with me, fine. You   want to take it to the captain,   fine. Through me. You do an end   run around me again, I'll snap   you back so hard, you'll think   you're a first year cadet again.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: May I speak frankly, sir?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: By all means.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You're in my way.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Really? How terrible for you.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: All you know how to do is play   it safe... I guess that's why   someone like you sits in the   shadow of a great man for as long   as you have, passing up one   command after another.       Proceed to deck eight.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: When it comes to this ship, to   this crew, you're damned right   I'll play it safe.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If you can't make the big   decisions, Commander, I suggest   you make room for someone who can.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain's log, supplemental. The   Enterprise remains concealed in   the dust cloud. And to my   surprise, the Borg have maintained   their position, waiting for us   to come out of hiding. I have   no explanation for their special   interest in me or this ship.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We continue to prepare our   defenses for the inevitable   confrontation. But, I must admit,   on this night I contemplate the   distinct possibility that no   defense may be adequate against   this enemy...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Trouble sleeping?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Something of a tradition,   Guinan... touring the ship before   a battle...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Before a hopeless battle, if I   remember the tradition correctly.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Not necessarily. Nelson toured   the HMS Victory before   Trafalgar...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: But Nelson didn't come home from   Trafalgar, did he?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: No, but the battle was won.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: And you, Picard, do you expect   this battle to be won?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We may yet prevail. It is a   conceit but a healthy one.       I wonder if the Emperor Honorious   watching the Visigoths coming over   the seventh hill could truly   realize that the Roman Empire was   about to fall. This is really   just another page of history,   isn't it? Will this be the end   of our civilization?       ... Turn the page.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It is not the end.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: You say that with remarkable   assuredness.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: With experience. When the Borg   destroyed my world, my people   scattered throughout the   universe. But we survived. And   so will humanity. As long as   there is a handful left to keep   the spirit alive. You will   prevail. Even if it takes a   millennium.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain Picard, report to the   bridge.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On my way, Lieutenant.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They're some kind of   magnetometric-guided charges.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Status of shields.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Back to forty-eight percent,   Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister La Forge, I may have to   take us out of the nebula... I'll   need all the power you can give   me.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Engines are ready, Captain.   Recommend you adjust shield   harmonics to favor the upper EM   band when you proceed...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Acknowledged.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Direct hit... deck nine...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Damage report...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Structural latching system   integrity breached...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Take us out of here, Number One...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fire up the engines... half   impulse until we clear the   nebula... then punch it to warp   nine.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Ready phasers... load forward   torpedo bays...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Engage.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Borg tractor beam is attempting   to lock on...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fire at will. Continue rotating   shield frequ...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shields are failing...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Tractor beam has locked on.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They're holding us...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It's no use... they've already   adapted to the new frequencies...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The Borg ship is disengaging...   leaving at warp speed...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Maintain pursuit...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Borg vessel has reached warp   nine... nine-point-four...   nine-point-six...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Stay with them.       Riker to O'Brien. Can you get   a fix on the captain?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Negative, sir. There's some kind   of interference. I can't lock   in on his signal.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Senior officers report to the   bridge.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, the coordinates they've   set... they're on a direct   course... to sector zero-zero-one.   The Terran system.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Earth.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain Jean-Luc Picard, you lead   the strongest ship of the   Federation Starfleet. You speak   for your people.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I have nothing to say to you, and   I will resist you with my last   ounce of strength.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Strength is irrelevant.   Resistance is futile. We wish to   improve ourselves. We will add   your biological and technological   distinctiveness to our own. Your   culture will adapt to service ours.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Impossible. My culture is based   on freedom and self-determination.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Freedom is irrelevant. Self-determination   is irrelevant. You must comply.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We would rather die.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Death is irrelevant.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What is it you wish of me?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Your archaic cultures are   authority driven. To facilitate   our introduction into your   societies, it has been decided   that a human voice will speak for   us in all communications. You   have been chosen to be that voice.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: They're leading us into the heart   of our own defenses...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: So far, they haven't had any   reason to worry about our   defenses...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander, if the Borg stay at   warp nine-point-six, we'll be   forced to discontinue pursuit and   power down in less than three   hours.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Two hours, forty minutes and three   seconds.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: How soon before the deflector is   ready?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We're close. Few hours maybe...    (before Riker has to     tell him)   I know I'll get it done in two...   somehow... but Commander, I need   serious power from the warp   engines to make this weapon work.   We're using all we've got just   to keep up with them...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've got to get that ship down   to impulse.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'm leading an away team over   there to get the captain back.   We'll find a way to bring them   out of warp...       Ensign Crusher... continue to   assist Mister La Forge...   Commander Shelby, you will take   the bridge and coordinate with   Starfleet... Data, Worf, Doctor   Crusher, you're with me...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Excuse me, sir... with my   knowledge of the Borg...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Those are my orders, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Riker...       It is inappropriate for you to   lead the away team. Until the   return of Captain Picard, you are   in command of the Enterprise.   We are in a state of war. Your   place is on the bridge.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Shelby, you will lead   the away team.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Make it so.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: First officer's log, supplemental.   Our pursuit of the Borg continues   at high warp on a course that   will take us to the very core of   the Federation. The devastation   they could bring is beyond   imagination.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: These phasers have been retuned.   Each has a different frequency   spanning the upper EM band.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: All right... a reminder... we only   get to use each of these once,   maybe twice before the Borg learn   to adapt. Don't fire until you   have to...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: What kind of resistance can we   expect?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: At our last encounter, the Borg   virtually ignored us when we   beamed aboard their vessel,   Doctor. They clearly did not   consider our being there a   threat.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: That could very well change,   however, if we start interfering   with their plans.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shelby to bridge. Away team   ready.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've got fifty-eight minutes   before we have to power down and   disengage.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Understood.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Proceed.       Commander, no unnecessary risks.   If it becomes clear you can't   succeed, I want you back here,   alive... I don't want any dead   heroes. Clear?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Very clear, sir. Shelby out.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've matched warp velocity for   transport, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Energize.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Tricorder functions are minimal.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Any signs of human life?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Inconclusive.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Look at this... this is   extraordinary.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: These appear to be some kind of   power waveguide conduits which   allow them to work collectively   as they perform ship functions.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: There's no way to take out enough   of these to slow them down.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The decentralized power system   makes it virtually impossible.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: (studying the     configuration)   What about looking at it... from   the mosquito's point of view.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: An interesting metaphor, Doctor.   What is your idea?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If we sting them in a tender   spot... at least we might get them   to stop a minute to scratch.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Distribution nodes.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: If we take out a few of these,   it just might make them scratch...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The captain's communicator...   it is still activated.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Crusher to Picard, can you hear   me, Captain...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Can you locate it, Worf?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: This way...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I strongly recommend redeploying   all available defenses to protect   sector zero-zero-one, Admiral...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We're moving to intercept at Wolf   three five nine. We'll make our   stand there. How much longer can   you maintain pursuit?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Twenty-two minutes if they stay   at current speed. If we can't   bring them out of warp, we'll   do as much damage as we can before   we have to disengage.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Picard?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Nothing yet, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: In here.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Shelby to Enterprise.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Go ahead.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We've found the captain's uniform.   And his communicator.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We're resuming our search.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Stand by, Commander.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We're in business.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: It'll burn out the main   deflector... but it'll be one hell   of a bang.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Radiation danger?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll need to evacuate the entire   forward half of the secondary   hull. And the lower three decks   of the saucer.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I'll see to that.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander Shelby... we have only   seventeen minutes of warp power   left. Do what you can to get   them out of warp.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Acknowledged. Shelby out.       Let's take out some of these   distribution nodes and see what   happens...       Get ready. This may rile up our   friends.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Ready phasers...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Fire.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Enterprise, encountering   resistance, prepare to beam us   back on my signal...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Enterprise... beam us...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Wait! Look --
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Captain!
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Enterprise, get us out of here.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, they did it... the Borg ship   is dropping out of warp...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Go to impulse.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Diverting warp energy to main   deflector...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Move us to within forty thousand   kilometers, match velocity.   Commence arming sequence...   Increase deflector modulation to   upper frequency band...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: The captain?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, Captain Picard has been   altered by the Borg. We were   unable to retrieve him...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Altered... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: He is a Borg, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll go back... I need more   people... we need to retune the   phasers again... we'll get him   out of there...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Commander, reading subspace field   fluctuations within the Borg ship.   Looks like they're regenerating...   restoring power. They could be   capable of warp any minute.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Is the deflector ready?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: (registering import of     the pending decision)   Ready, sir.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Will, he's alive... if we get him   back, I might be able to   restore...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: This is our only chance to destroy   them... if they get back into warp,   our weapon becomes useless.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We'll go back... we'll sabotage   them again if we have to...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: We can't maintain pursuit. We   don't have the power.       Prepare to fire.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: At least consult with Starfleet   Command.       Get Admiral Hanson on subspace...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Belay that order, Lieutenant.   There's no time...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Sir, we are being hailed by the   Borg...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: On screen.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: I am Locutus of Borg. Resistance   is futile. Your life as it has   been is over. From this time   forward, you will service... us.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"

quote: Mister Worf... fire.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part I"
